remarks: The fundamental solution as an infimum is itself a solution, showing that the solution set is discrete. Since the fundamental solution is an infimum, there must be an element ge to Fund and lt 2*Fund.  If this element is equal to the fundamental solution we're done, otherwise use the infimum again to find another element which must be ge Fund and lt the first element; their ratio is a group element in (1,2), contradicting ~ pell14qrgapw .  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Sep-2014.)
statement: pellfundex $p |- ( D e. ( NN \ []NN ) -> ( PellFund ` D ) e. ( Pell1QR ` D ) ) $.
